Package org.world.agents.enemies.AI

Interface AI

public interface AI
Abstract class to implement some AI-related methods, currently only used for one type of pathfinding

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static int[][] PARAMS
    Parameter list for easy accessing of neighbouring points, first half represents straight moves, second half diagonal ones

  • Method Summary

    Static Methods 
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static java.util.ArrayList<Point> aStar​(int xStart, int yStart, int xDest, int yDest)
    Applies the A* search algorithm on the current game world, with the given start and destination coordinates.
    private static java.util.ArrayList<Point> buildPath​(Point dest)
    Given a destination point, builds a path to the original source by going along the parent chain
    static boolean isTraversable​(int x, int y)
    Method to simplify checking whether the tile at given coordinates exists and is traversable.
    static boolean isValidMove​(int x, int y, float z)
    Checks whether moving through tile x,y is possible (tile exists, is traversable and no obstacles are inside of it)

  • Field Details

    • PARAMS

      static final int[][] PARAMS
      Parameter list for easy accessing of neighbouring points, first half represents straight moves, second half diagonal ones

  • Method Details

    • isValidMove

      static boolean isValidMove​(int x, int y, float z)
      Checks whether moving through tile x,y is possible (tile exists, is traversable and no obstacles are inside of it)
      Parameters:
      x - isometric x coordinate of the tile
      y - isometric y coordinate of the tile
      Returns:
      boolean value

    • isTraversable

      static boolean isTraversable​(int x, int y)
      Method to simplify checking whether the tile at given coordinates exists and is traversable. In some cases whether decorations are present or not is not relevant (for example in enemy movement when enemies can move around obstacles while still in the same tile as the obstacle) so this method is preferred to isValidMove In case the given coordinates are out of bounds, the function returns false
      Parameters:
      x - isometric x coordinate of the tile
      y - isometric y coordinate of the tile

    • buildPath

      private static java.util.ArrayList<Point> buildPath​(Point dest)
      Given a destination point, builds a path to the original source by going along the parent chain
      Parameters:
      dest - destination point
      Returns:
      an array list of point from the destination to the source

    • aStar

      static java.util.ArrayList<Point> aStar​(int xStart, int yStart, int xDest, int yDest)
      Applies the A* search algorithm on the current game world, with the given start and destination coordinates. It is essentially a "guided" extension of Dijkstra's algorithm, employing a heuristic to improve performance It only considers tiles to be traversable when they are marked as such and there are no obstacles present
      Parameters:
      xStart - isometric coordinate of the starting point
      yStart - isometric coordinate of the starting point
      xDest - isometric coordinate of the starting point
      yDest - isometric coordinate of the starting point
      Returns:
      an array list of the points along the path from destination to the source
